reviewText: Excellent movie about a husband that fakes his own death in order to move on with his own life. His wife and sons struggle to come to terms with his demise only to find out many years later that he was very much alive.

reviewText: Patrick (Jay O. Sanders) and Elizabeth Welsh ("Margaret Colin) are former high school sweethearts who are living an idyllic life as happy parents of 2 young boys. This storybook tale soon turns from the perfect love story to a harrowing mystery. Patrick is a loving husband and father who leads a comfortable life amoung his country club friends, but beneath is a criminal who betrays trusts and steals dreams without conscience.When finally exposed for using university funds for his own purpose, Patrick's guilt and embarrassment leads him to an apparent suicide. His body is never recovered. Elizabeth not only has the trauma of losing her beloved husband, but she is left virtually penniless. Despite her struggles, Elizabeth eventually becomes a successful leader within her community.Just as time has nearly erased most of her deep emotional scars, she begins to unravel the true mystery of her husband's disappearance.As she tries to track down events that led to her husband's disappearance, Elizabeth is unsure of what she will find. A part of her needs to know the truth, while another part knows that opening this chapter will dredge up painful memories and angry feelings. She knows that she must do what is right for herself, her family and others that were betrayed.Based on a true story.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I prefer non-fiction movies & this one is excellent.  It was amazing what the wife had to endure because of her husband's evil.  "Selfish" & "Greedy" doesn't even come close to describing what this bum put his family through - emotionally, physically & financially.  Margaret Colin did a superb job, playing a determined wife who persevered in the face of tremendous hardship & helped bring her husband to justice.  Also yet another failure of our pathetic "injustice" system - the perpetrator was sentenced to four years & only served eight months.
Title: N/A
